DPD RI Usulkan Pemekaran Papua dari Dua Jadi Empat Provinsi
02 Nov 2019, 16:23 by Miechell Octovy Koagouw


DPD RI Usulkan Pemekaran Papua dari Dua Jadi Empat Provinsi

KBRN, Jakarta : Senin mendatang, tepatnya mulai 4 November 2019, Panitia Khusus (Pansus) Papua akan mulai bekerja dengan menggelar sejumlah rapat, sampai pemanggilan tokoh masyarakat Papua dan lainnya untuk diajak dialog."Senin mendatang mulai rapat-rapat. Mulai bekerja. Memanggil tokoh untuk dialog," kata Wakil Ketua Dewan Perwakilan Daerah (DPD) RI, Nono Sampono dalam siaran langsung dengan RRI PRO3 usai acara Pers Gathering yang mengangkat tema 'Sinergitas DPD RI dan Insan Pers Guna Penguatan Peran DPD RI Dalam Memperjuangkan Aspirasi Daerah' di Surabaya, Jumat (1/11/2019) malam. Mengenai target kerja Pansus Papua, Nono menargetkan tidak terlalu lama, tiga bulan saja menurutnya harus ada tindak lanjut. Kemudian semua kementerian dan lembaga pasti akan diundang pula untuk membahas masalah Papua bersama-sama."Ini bagian dari kontribusi DPD menyelesaikan berbagai persoalan bangsa. Masalah Papua ini persoalan daerah yang jadi nasional, jadi DPD layak terlibat langsung (untuk menyelesaikan). Kami juga berharap akan menyelesaikan persoalan bangsa di daerah lainnya," ujar Nono menambahkan.DPD RI mengusulkan, untuk meminimalisir konflik, sekaligus memudahkan penyelesaian masalah-masalah ke depannya, perlu adanya dua Provinsi lagi di Papua. Ini dengan kata lain, harus ada pemekaran di Papua. Karena rentang kendali dalam menata dan menyelesaikan persoalan di Papua itu sangat berat jika masih terbagi dalam dua provinsi saja (Papua dan Papua Barat)."Selatan dan Pegunungan bisa masing-masing satu (provinsi). Dan saya dengar Presiden dan Mendagri sependapat," tutupnya.BACA JUGA: Nono Sampono : DPD Bentuk Pansus Papua, 15 Orang Dipimpin Fachrul Razi
Seperti diberitakan RRI sebelumnya, salah satu program dalam waktu dekat ini segera dilakukan oleh Dewan Perwakilan Daerah (DPD) RI adalah pembentukan Panitia Khusus (Pansus) untuk Papua. Hal ini diungkapkan Wakil Ketua DPD RI Nono Sampono dalam siaran langsung dengan RRI PRO3 usai acara Pers Gathering yang mengangkat tema 'Sinergitas DPD RI dan Insan Pers Guna Penguatan Peran DPD RI Dalam Memperjuangkan Aspirasi Daerah' di Surabaya, Jumat (1/11/2019) malam. Nono lanjut menuturkan, DPD menilai, masalah Papua yang berada di wilayah timur Indonesia, menjadi persoalan yang harus segera diselesaikan."Saya baru pulang dari Manokwari, Sorong, Raja Ampat, Sorong, karena saat letupan awal memang berawal dari Manokwari dan Sorong baru melebar ke wilayah lain, sampai baru-baru ini Wamena," sebut Nono kepada RRI.Untuk kerusuhan terakhir yang terjadi di Wamena, dirinya bersyukur pemerintah melalui TNI-Polri telah menempuh langkah-langkah baik guna menyelesaikan persoalan awal dengan pendekatan keamanan dan hukum. Dan untuk meneruskannya, DPD RI, kata dia, ingin menyelesaikan persoalan sampai ke akar masalah.Akar masalahnya menurut Nono adalah keadilan, sosial, budaya, kemudian pendidikan, layanan kesehatan, dan harus ditempuh melalui pendekatan-pendekatan kultural. Selain itu, ekonomi juga perlu tumbuh agar masyarakat di sana meningkat pula penghasilan dan kesejahteraannya."Papua dan Papua Barat itu nomor satu dan nomor dua provinsi miskin di Indonesia selain Maluku, NTT dan Gorontalo. Lima besar miskin itu," ujarnya.Mengenai Pansus, nantinya tim akan bekerja membantu pemerintah dalam hal ini bagaimana segera cari solusi penyelesaian akar masalah di Papua."Pansus nanti ada 15 orang, dipimpin Wakil Ketua I dari Komite I DPD RI, Fachrul Razi," pungkasnya. (Sumber: Jorike Fitri/RRI-PRO3)

DPD RI Proposes Expansion of Papua from Two to Four Provinces
02 Nov 2019, 16:23 by Miechell Octovy Koagouw


DPD RI Proposes Expansion of Papua from Two to Four Provinces

KBRN, Jakarta: Next Monday, starting on November 4, 2019, the Papua Special Committee (Pansus) will start working by holding a number of meetings, until the calling of Papuan community leaders and others to be invited to dialogue. "Next Monday start meetings. Start working. Calling figure for dialogue, "said Deputy Chairman of the Regional Representatives Council (DPD) of Indonesia, Nono Sampono in a live broadcast with RRI PRO3 after the Press Gathering event with the theme 'Synergy of the DPD RI and the Pers of the Press to Strengthen the Role of the DPD RI in Fighting for Regional Aspirations' in Surabaya , Friday (11/01/2019) night. Regarding the work target of the Papua Special Committee, Nono targets not to be too long, according to him, there should be a further three months. Then all ministries and institutions will also be invited to discuss the problem of Papua together. "This is part of the DPD's contribution to solving various problems of the nation. The problem of Papua is the regional problem that becomes national, so the DPD deserves to be directly involved (to solve). We also hope will solve the nation's problems in other areas, "Nono added. DPD RI proposed, to minimize conflict, while simultaneously facilitating the resolution of problems in the future, there should be two more Provinces in Papua. In other words, there must be a division in Papua. Because the span of control in managing and solving problems in Papua is very heavy if it is still divided into two provinces (Papua and West Papua). "South and Mountains can each be one (province). And I hear the President and the Minister of Home Affairs agree," he concluded . READ ALSO: Nono Sampono: DPD Forms Papua Special Committee, 15 People Led by Fachrul Razi
As reported by RRI beforehand, one of the programs in the near future to be immediately carried out by the Regional Representative Council (DPD) RI is the formation of a Special Committee (Special Committee) for Papua. This was revealed by Deputy Chairman of the DPD RI Nono Sampono in a live broadcast with RRI PRO3 after the Press Gathering event with the theme 'Synergy of the DPD RI and Press Persons to Strengthen the Role of the DPD RI in Fighting for Regional Aspirations' in Surabaya, Friday (1/11/2019) night. Nono went on to say, the DPD considered that the problem of Papua in eastern Indonesia was a problem that had to be resolved immediately. "I just returned from Manokwari, Sorong, Raja Ampat, Sorong, because when the initial explosion did start from Manokwari and Sorong just widened to other regions, until recently Wamena, "Nono said to RRI. For the latest unrest that occurred in Wamena, he was grateful the government through the TNI-Polri had taken good steps to resolve the initial problem with a security and legal approach. And to continue, the DPD RI, he said, wanted to solve the problem to the root of the problem. The problem according to Nono was justice, social, culture, then education, health services, and had to be taken through cultural approaches. In addition, the economy also needs to grow so that the people there also increase their income and welfare. "Papua and West Papua are number one and number two poor provinces in Indonesia besides Maluku, NTT and Gorontalo. The top five are poor," he said. Regarding the Special Committee, later the team will work to help the government in this matter how to immediately find solutions to solve the root problems in Papua. "There will be 15 special committee members, led by Deputy Chair I of the Committee I DPD RI, Fachrul Razi," he concluded. (Source: Jorike Fitri / RRI-PRO3)
